titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Holdings at the Litchfield Historical Society
titlestmt.author: Collection Description/Finding Aid prepared by Leith Johnson.

publicationstmt.p: © Copyright 2009 Litchfield Historical Society. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was encoding in EAD by Archon 2.22 from an SQL database source on May 19th, 2010.

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Papers relating to the Brown and Johnson families and related lineages of Litchfield, Naugatuck, Torrington and elsewhere consisting of original and copied source materials. The materials comprised ten binders and include 18th and 19th century publications, such as Hutchins' Revived Almanac (1814), Old Farmer's Almanac (1835), Centennial Exposition guide (1876); correspondence; family records and cerificates; bills and receipts; clippings; genealogical information; and photographs, including cartes-de-viste, cabinet cards, and tintypes, circa 1860s-1960s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers relating to the Brown and Johnson families and related lineages of Litchfield, Naugatuck, Torrington and elsewhere consisting of original and copied source materials. The materials comprised ten binders and include 18th and 19th century publications, such as Hutchins' Revived Almanac (1814), Old Farmer's Almanac (1835), Centennial Exposition guide (1876); correspondence; family records and cerificates; bills and receipts; clippings; genealogical information; and photographs, including cartes-de-viste, cabinet cards, and tintypes, circa 1860s-1960s.
A paper inventory is available for the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Materials
arrangement.p: The papers are arranged by type and then generally chronologically.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Litchfield Historical Society for materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: David W. Brown Collection (2005-49-0), Litchfield Historical Society, Helga J. Ingraham Memorial Library, P.O. Box 385, 7 South Street, Litchfield, Connecticut, 06759

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Litchfield Historical Society from David W. Brown on 12/07/2005.

odd.head: Other Information
odd.p: This collection was processed with support from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission (NHPRC).
